metadata.title: CVE-2022-26365 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Linux disk/nic frontends data leaks T[his CNA information record relates tomultiple CVEs; the text explains which aspects/vulnerabilities correspondto which CVE.] Linux Block and Network PV device frontends don't zeromemory regions before sharing them with the backend (CVE-2022-26365,CVE-2022-33740). Additionally the granularity of the grant table doesn'tallow sharing less than a 4K page, leading to unrelated data residing inthe same 4K page as data shared with a backend being accessible by suchbackend (CVE-2022-33741, CVE-2022-33742).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26365` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required

xen package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
